###RANDOM GENERATION OF POWERPOINT DISTRIBUTED VALUES:
<br>

From [Wolfram alpha](http://mathworld.wolfram.com/RandomNumber.html),

The pdf of the power law is

$$f_X(x) =C x^n, x \in [x_0, x_1]$$
and the normaliztion constant can be determined by considering that $f_X(x)$ has to integrate to 1:

$$\int_{x_0}^{x_1} f_X(x)dx= C \frac{[x^{n+1}]_{x_0}^{x_1}}{n+1}=1$$
and hence,

$$C=\frac{n+1}{x_1^{n+1}- x_0^{n+1}}.$$

The cumulative probability distribution is

$$F_X(x) = \Pr(X <x)=\int_{x_0}^x C x^n dx =\frac{C}{n+1}\left(x^{n+1}-x_0^{n+1  }\right)$$

If $Y\sim U[0,1]$ and by the [probability integral transform
](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inverse_transform_sampling),

$$y\equiv \frac{C}{n+1} \left(x^{n+1}-x_0^{n+1} \right)$$

So $y=g(x)$ with inverse

$$X = \left( \frac{n+1}{C}y + x_0^{n+1}    \right)^{1/{n+1}}$$


and replacing $C$

$$X = \left[ (x_1^{n+1}-x_0^{n+1})y + x_0^{n+1}    \right]^{1/{n+1}}$$
which is different from page 3 of [this document](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bwl-HpVJ_5PeUWliQ2F0OUo3NVE/view?usp=sharing).

In R

```{r}
x1 = 8
x0 = 0.1
n = -2.5
y = runif(1e5)
x = ((x1^(n+1) - x0^(n+1))*y + x0^(n+1))^(1/(n+1))
hist(x, breaks=20, probability = T)
```
